Inviting leaders of the Hong Kong tourism industry to Macau for an exchange visit and for Hong Kong influencers to experience Macau's "tourism +" concept, this time organizing representatives from the Hong Kong tourism industry and media to visit Macau again to increase marketing efforts and attract Hong Kong tourists to stay overnight in Macau, thereby expanding the "tourism +" market between the two places, and promoting the recovery of the tourism industries in both regions.

Google AI chatbot "makes mistakes" parent company's stock plummets billions of dollars.
(Comprehensive News Report for Day 11)

Google's newly launched artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has faced criticism, with the company's stock price plummeting 8.9% on Thursday, falling below $100, and its market value evaporating by $110 billion (approximately RM476.5 billion). As of Friday's closing price, the stock had recovered to $94.57.
Market worried about Alphabet not keeping up with Microsoft in competition.

According to a report by Reuters, Google released a promotional video for its AI chatbot Bard earlier, in which someone asks Bard: "Can you tell me about the new discoveries of the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) for my 9-year-old son?"
"Bard mentioned in his answer that the telescope had captured the first image of a sun outside the solar system."

However, according to the data from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration of the United States, the first picture of an exoplanet outside the solar system was taken by the "Very Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
"The Road and Bridge Press reported on the topic of 'Bard's Answer to Errors Leads to Stock Price Plunge'."

On the other hand, Google notes that Bard's response "emphasized the importance of strict testing procedures" and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response meets high standards in terms of quality, safety, and accuracy.
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly with an increase of 19 times in incoming visitors compared to 2021.

According to the latest news (11-day electrical), the Singapore Tourism Board has recently announced that the number of international visitors to Singapore is expected to reach 12-14 million in 2023, generating around SGD 18-21 billion in tourism revenue; the number of visitors and tourism revenue are expected to recover to around 67-75% of the pre-pandemic level in 2023, and the tourism industry is expected to fully recover in 2024 with a high possibility.
The Singapore tourism market gradually restarted and recovered in 2022.

According to the latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board, the number of visitors to Singapore in 2022 increased by 19 times compared to 2021, reaching 630 million people, exceeding the previous estimate of 400 million to 600 million people. Visitors have already recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

From January to September 2022, the total tourism revenue in Singapore was 89.6 billion new Singapore dollars, with a predicted total of 138-143 billion new Singapore dollars for the year, representing a 6-7 times increase compared to 2021, and already recovering to around 50-52% of the pre-pandemic level in 2019.
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced a budget of nearly 5 billion new yuan to stimulate the tourism industry's recovery.

The tourism bureau recently announced that it will allocate 1.1 billion new yuan from the budget in the next two years to launch more commercial and recreational activities to attract more tourists to return.

To make healthy living and wellness become one of Singapore's tourist attractions, the Singapore Tourism Board released an intention-to-tender activity on November 23, 2022, to develop a healthy lifestyle park in the southern coast of Singapore.

The executive director of Singapore's Tourism Board, Wang Ling, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have been putting their physical health as the top priority when planning their trips.

Developing a health and wellness resort in the southern coastal area of Singapore, with the presence of the Marina Bay Gardens and the Marina Bay Barrage, has the potential to contribute to the tourism industry and economy of Singapore, allowing tourists to spend more time and money in the country.
Singapore Tourism Board Chairman Chen Zhiqing said that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism product.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the tourism department has been promoting health and wellness projects to local residents and international tourists over the past two years.
June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, providing over 130 types of health activities and experiences for the public.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for tourists.

Here is the translation of the Chinese text into English:

Besides the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, the Gardens by the Bay's Avatar World, the ArtScience Museum's "Explore New Horizons" exhibition hall, and the night safari's new outdoor theater, the Tourism Board will support the development and updates of Wildlife World's Bird Paradise and other projects, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will establish industry standards for sustainable development of the meetings, incentives, conferencing, and exhibitions (MICE) industry by 2023, with a focus on improving waste management and carbon emissions in two key areas, further optimizing the travel environment.
The revival of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to data, as of December 18, 2022, the passenger throughput at Shenzhen Airport has been robustly recovering, with an average of 15 million passengers per day and around 100 million passengers per week, which is equivalent to about 75% of the passenger volume before the pandemic. The number of airport employees has also been recovering to around 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the data, between January and October 2022, Singapore received 2360 million tourists, equivalent to 42% of the number before the COVID-19 pandemic, with a decrease of 17,000 flights, which is equivalent to 53% of the number before the pandemic.
The tourism industry is quickly recovering, also driving the recovery of accommodation, transportation, dining, and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and tourism industry have a high expectation for the Chinese market.

Ms. Qiao Shu Dan, assistant director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey conducted by China's travel platform showed that Singapore's safety index ranked third globally, which is one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the new coronavirus outbreak, China had approximately 36 million people traveling to Singapore for vacation each year.
With the relaxation of China's border control policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 2019 levels of 30% to 60% this year.
Ms. Qiao pointed out that the tourism agency will closely monitor the signal of China's further relaxation of policies for outbound travel, in response to the changing needs of tourists.

Singapore Tourism Board, in addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, will proactively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists with new trends emerging abroad.

Looking forward to 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is filled with confidence, believing that as long as there is no significant deterioration in the global economy and no new large-scale pandemics, the tourism industry will recover faster than expected.
Kim Jong-un's father and daughter have a close interaction, while his wife is ignored.

North Korea held a military parade on its 75th anniversary of founding on August 11, with leader Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Yo-jong not only attending the event but also standing on the podium alongside her father.

The Korean government released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Jong-un bowing down beside his father's body, whispering and speaking softly to him, gently cradling his father's face with both hands, even touching his father's chest, and the heartwarming interaction between the father and daughter was broadcasted throughout the country.
However, First Lady Li Xuejun could only retreat to the side.

Based on the Korean news reports, Kim Jong-un and his wife Li Sol-ju, along with their daughter Kim Ju-ae, attended a banquet on July 7th, and in the official photo of the event, Kim Ju-ae was not only sitting in a rare position, but also stood alongside her parents on the podium during the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army the following day.
North Korean media "released footage of a military parade after the event, revealing more intimate scenes of father and daughter."

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium with a smile on his face, and the two of them whispered to each other in each other's ears, Kim Jong-un once picked up his father's cheeks with both hands and smiled back at him.

Other media also showed that Kim Jong-un and Kim Yo-jong were sitting on a sofa inside the room, constantly touching their father's face with their hands; when they walked hand in hand with their father, they would also touch his chest with their hands.
The first lady, Li Xiuzhen, could only walk behind or sit beside her husband and daughter, always a few steps away from them.

According to Korean media, Kim Jong-un has been exposed to the public for the fifth time since his debut on November 18th last year, with his face showing up more and more frequently over the past three months.

The Korean media mentioned that Kim Jong-un used the most endearing terms to refer to his son, such as "beloved child" or "precious child," and broadcast footage of him repeatedly shouting his loyalty to his ancestral bloodline while watching the military parade.

These signs have led the outside world to speculate that Kim Jong-un has already been determined as the successor to the Kim family regime, with some analyses suggesting that "this is Kim Jong-un's signal to appoint his daughter as his successor," although there are also views that this judgment is still premature, as there are still various possibilities while Kim Jong-un is still in power and has a son.
How to view the recent unexpectedly high US non-farm employment data in January and the future trend - Economic Observer, a professional financial news website.

Sure, here's the translation:

"Please ask about the view of Renyang Investment on the January non-farm employment data in the United States exceeding expectations and the future trend."

Here is the translation of the Chinese text:

On February 3rd, the US Labor Department released the January 2023 non-farm employment data, with a new increase of 51.7 million non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market expectation of 18.9 million; the unemployment rate dropped to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; and the hourly wage growth rate was 4.4%, slightly slower than the previous month's growth rate of 0.3%.

From a quantitative perspective, there are many one-time and technical factors that have caused fluctuations in this data, such as the return of striking teachers, the adjustment of survey statistics, and the update of seasonal factors. In the future, there may be further adjustments (referring to the recent downward revision of non-agricultural employment from 50.4 million to 36.4 million in January 2022). Non-agricultural employment or unemployment data may be more robust than it appears.

From a structural perspective, high-tech enterprises have seen a more limited impact from layoffs, but the proportion is relatively low; while the service industry, particularly leisure hotels, education and healthcare, have seen a significant increase in new job additions, with labor shortages still persisting in the service sector.

Combining the same high expectations for service sector PMI, job vacancy and labor shortage data, as well as consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry has recovered rapidly after the extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply of labor in the US job market cannot be improved without a decline in the economy.

Currently, there are approximately 500 million labor shortages in the US labor market, and the participation rate of the labor force is slowing down, particularly among workers aged 25-54, whose participation rate has already reached a level close to that before the epidemic.
Except for this, the strong savings and consumption credit of Americans will further hinder the impact of tightening policies on the labor market.
The tight labor market supply in the US will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.
The recent surge in interest rates has repeatedly raised inflation expectations, and we are not optimistic about the continued decrease in our salaries.
Before this data is released, the US stock market has overly optimistic expectations for the Fed's rate hiking path.

As inflation data continues to improve, the Federal Reserve is simultaneously shortening the pace of interest rate hikes while maintaining a delicate balance between inflation expectations and market expectations, but the market is not seeing the Fed's hawkish stance, not only expecting an earlier end to rate hikes, but also expecting two rate cuts by the end of the year.

In the context of tight labor market supply and demand, we believe that the Fed's year-end interest rate guidance is relatively reasonable, but the market's extreme expectations and adjustments, as well as the congestion in trading, may cause some harm to the market.

Although it is difficult to change the trend of slowing inflation despite the recent improvement in wage growth, with the M2 data turning negative and various CPI sub-indices showing gradual improvements, the US CPI data has been steadily declining since October, and the persistence of wage growth will only serve as a foundation for future inflation data, and the current market expectations are difficult to verify, after the release of the next inflation data, the market may enter a new round of speculation.

Zhang Yong, the founder of Shengyuan, passed away suddenly due to a heart attack, leaving behind a legacy of transforming China's garment industry - Economic Observer, a professional financial news website.

According to Economic Observer's reporter Zhang Jingxin on February 11th, the verified entity of the WeChat public account is Shen Shen Holdings Limited (hereinafter referred to as "Shen Shen Holdings"), and the chairman of the board of directors of Shen Shen Holdings, Zhang Yongkang, died of sudden heart disease on February 10, 2023, at the age of 65.

In the 1980s, Zhang Yong served as the factory director of a state-owned cotton mill. With his appointment, Zhang Yong became the factory director of Nanbo Yunshan Garment Co., Ltd., the predecessor of Jiansheng Textile Co., Ltd., in 1989.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leadership Annual Meeting and the 22nd China Enterprise Future Star Annual Meeting, Zhang Yong said in his speech that in the 1990s, the market share of the Juzi brand in China's western clothing market had reached 37%.
Shantou Woolen Textile Company (600884.SH) went public in 1996 and became the first listed company in the Chinese clothing industry.

Just as the clothing business was booming like never before, Jing Jing Group suddenly started to transform, because Zhen Yong realized that "Once the market opens, the Chinese brand will naturally form a hierarchical brand market, and Jing Jing Western clothing will always be the leader, long-term becoming the national uniform of China's possibility is small."

In 1999, Shuangshuang began researching corporate transformation, and Zhenyong remembered that year, "We came to Shanghai and searched for ways to transform the company, consulting with many experts and scholars, holding numerous seminars and workshops."
Finally, we set two major strategic directions.
The first direction is new energy and new materials, while the other is big health with a future.

After the strategic direction is determined, Jing starts searching for collaboration, and at that time, the Thermal Energy Research Institute of Shanxi University, which is responsible for the national 863 program's "Carbon Micro-Balls" project, lacks research funds. Therefore, Jing and the Thermal Energy Research Institute sign a cooperation agreement to jointly promote the industrialization of the "Carbon Micro-Balls" project, and engage in the research and development, production, and sales of negative materials. They aim to commercialize negative materials in the domestic market.

In 2001, Shunxin Group realized the scale production of intermediate-sized ceramic balls, and started to domesticize the supply of intermediate-sized ceramic balls, replacing Japan as the main supplier in the domestic market.
This is the first lithium-ion battery negative electrode material manufacturing company in China, which has achieved the domestic production of lithium-ion battery negative electrode materials.

As the application of lithium batteries rapidly gains popularity, Jiaxing Jingda's lithium battery business begins to gradually develop, and in 2007, the lithium material business is written into Jiaxing Jingda's main business, while the clothing business revenue decreases year by year until 2013, at which point Jiaxing Jingda's lithium material business revenue exceeds that of the clothing business.

In February 2021, Shunki Corporation successfully acquired the LG Chemical optical film business and entered the LCD optical film market, establishing Shunki Optoelectronics, a leading optical film company. This move marked a significant expansion of Shunki's technological capabilities, as its main competitors in this field are among the world's top 500 companies, such as Samsung of South Korea, Sumitomo Chemical of Japan, and Japan Display.

Chen Yonggang once shared his thoughts on post-acquisition management, "China's private enterprises acquiring some high-tech companies overseas have a relatively low success rate, why do these acquisitions fail?"

Because everyone knows, I spent so much money, so I have to send someone to manage it, which is a common practice. However, Zhang Yongguang is different, on the day of the successful acquisition of Shandong Jingdong, Zhang Yongguang suddenly appeared at the scene and announced that Shandong Jingdong would implement a dual-listed system, except for Zhang Yongguang as chairman, no one from Shandong Jingdong would be appointed to Shandong Gold, and the existing distribution system, corporate culture, and various management modes would remain unchanged.

According to the ICC鑫椤资讯 released in 2022, the shipment volume of sulfide materials exceeded 20,000 tons, with a year-on-year increase of 100%, accounting for 16% of the market share. The synthetic graphite materials shipped were ranked first.

According to Yano Research, the market share of Shandong Qingyuan Optoelectronics in the LED industry reached 29% in 2022 and is expected to reach 32% in 2023, maintaining its position as the global leader.

Before the third quarter of 2022, Shun Shun Group's revenue was 158.41 billion yuan, net profit was 23.13 billion yuan, and on February 10th, the stock price of Shun Shun Group was 19.24 yuan per share, with a total market value of 436 billion yuan.

February 9th, Shenmao Stock expressed on the interactive platform that the company's lithium battery capacity will reach about 10 million tons by the end of 2022, and the capacity of the Mount Tai project is still in the process of increasing.
Wan De is currently the chairman and actual controller of Shan Shan Holdings.
The sky eye display shows that Zhang Yong holds 40.1% of the total shares of Shuisheng Control Company.

The general manager of Shunshun Holdings is Li Zhihua, born in 1968. He has served as the chairman of Shunshun Battery Materials Co., Ltd. in Dongguan, the chairman of Shunshun New Materials Technology Co., Ltd. in Ningbo, and the deputy general manager of Shunshun Holdings Co., Ltd. in Ningbo.
The company's high-level management personnel and actual controllers do not have any family relationships.

February 10th, the regulatory body announced that the "E-Fund Account" app was launched on various mobile app stores and opened for public testing.

According to the introduction, "基金E账户" provides a "one-stop" query service for personal investors to obtain information on public fund accounts and subscription quotas, with the aim of resolving the pain points of forgetful accounts and cumbersome queries in the industry.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic asset management firms managing public funds with a total scale of around 26 trillion yuan; 167 registration agencies for public fundraising, and 411 distribution agencies.
Each department's accounting system is independent and lacks an industry-wide query channel.

Investors can easily and quickly grasp the situation of holding the mutual funds managed by the asset management companies under their control through the "fund E account," which enables them to fully enhance the query efficiency of the entire market.

After the trial period ends, users no longer need to invite codes to register.

Labor Union Against Government Retirement Reform Rallies Big March

Saturday, February 11th (2nd week of February), French unions again launched a nationwide protest against the government's pension reform draft, calling on citizens to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth action day of the social movement against the government's pension reform draft.
The number of citizens responding to the rally call may affect the union's next action plan.

This has been a month-long effort by the eight major labor unions in France, who have come together for the fourth time to mobilize the nation, and it is the first time that the protest will be held on a Saturday.

Given that for most French people, Saturday is a weekend day off, they don't need to attend the protest and strike activities on this day, but rather make a choice between participating in the protest and taking a day off work, the union hopes that today's gathering activity can attract more people to participate.

The public transportation system, including the subway and public railways, as well as their employee unions, have not called for strikes today, and the public transportation should operate normally, allowing citizens to take buses or trains to the gathering point. Meanwhile, in areas where schools have started their winter breaks, people can go on their usual holiday trips.

The labor union hopes that today's gathering will have over 100 million participants, while the police expect the total number of participants nationwide to be between 60 million and 80 million, with possibly 900,000 to 1.2 million people gathering in the Paris area.

Since the start of the protests against the pension reform plan, although public opinion polls show that most French people do not support pushing back the mandatory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people actually taking to the streets has gradually decreased.
The first strike demonstration activity on January 31st gathered 127,000 to 250,000 people across the nation.
The protest crowd on Wednesday (February 7th) has already shrunk to between 750,000 and 200,000 people nationwide.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition, particularly the radical left-wing opposition parties, have submitted numerous amendments, resulting in a slow and sluggish legislative process.
The debate between the two camps is becoming increasingly intense.

A left-wing radical political party in France recently sparked controversy by posting a picture of a soccer ball with a cartoon image of the labor minister on it on social media, which was seen as disrespectful to the government.
The chairperson of the National People's Congress announced that the member would be banned from participating in parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for their behavior.

Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France over the past 20 years, the government has made only minor adjustments to the draft so far, but has not made any significant concessions.
The union has already prepared to take action again on next Friday, March 16th, which is the day when the draft reform plan will be submitted to the Senate for discussion.
China encourages high-quality education by raising the bar for gifted students.

"In 9 days, the Yunnan Province of China will launch a publicity campaign to solicit donations of human sperm from college students or those with a higher education background. Successful donors will receive a reward of 4,500 yuan."

According to the report by the China Youth Daily, China encourages college students to donate their organs.

Each top-tier university in China has the highest donation standards for Beijing, not only requiring a certain level of education, but also stipulating that the height must be above 170 cm, the five senses must be well-proportioned, and there must be no obvious hair loss or near-sightedness, with the degree of near-sightedness not exceeding 600 degrees.

According to the report, the Yunnan Provincial Human Sperm Bank states that donors can receive a value of 1000 yuan for a comprehensive male health check, including DNA testing, which is of great significance for understanding one's reproductive status.

The conditions for donating include: height of 165 cm or above, higher education or currently studying, free of color blindness and hearing impairment, and without liver and other inherited or infectious diseases.

According to a report by China Newsweek, the human sperm bank in Shaanxi Province has issued an advertisement with the slogan "Donate sperm, infinite glory," urging young people to respond and encourage netizens to forward related information, "Let love be passed on."

Shaanxi province's price level is higher than Yunnan, and those who complete a certain number of donations can receive a cash reward of 300 yuan per time, while those who complete a larger number of donations can receive a cash reward of 5000 yuan.
The current highest price is in Beijing, with a maximum subsidy of 5150 yuan.

It took me a lot of time to read the whole book, but I couldn't stop.

The vivid and detailed portrayal of characters and emotions in his works is extremely impressive, with some characters making only occasional appearances but leaving a deep impact on readers. Fan favorites like Ye Shuangqian, Huang Shaotian, and Zhang Xiaohu are particularly well-written and have a large following, while characters who are not the focus of the story, such as Jiang Wan and Liu Qing, are also well-liked by readers. The fact that not a single unlikable character can be found in his works is a testament to his success in characterization.

In terms of emotions, there is no need to exaggerate the so-called "beautiful" or "flawless" appearance of the three thousand million or the "rotten" or "decayed" appearance of the vulgar. Everyone's emotions have a common ground, which is their love for the game of glory and their desire for a decisive victory.
Little plots without any grand schemes, each person looks so innocent and cute.
This may be why there are no unpleasant characters in full-time work.
Full credit goes to this.

A long time ago, I happened to see something that left a deep impression on me, so I wrote it down later.
This book can be more accurately described as a collection of fragments about love in life, rather than a short story collection.

The tone of this book is extremely plain, much like a calm and peaceful lake, with simple and concise language that seeks to convey a sense of serenity and tranquility, much like a quiet afternoon on a bustling street during the summer.
Every short story is just a small segment of mundane life with no beginning or end.
The final collection is titled "What Do We Talk About When We Talk About Love?"

I think, this short story collection, along with its title, can be seen as a form of behavioral art, as the author wants to express that love is not just the happy and sad moments on stage, but also the mundane and ordinary aspects of life, the repetition and routine, the emptiness and apathy, and the avoidance of reality and uncertainty of the future.
While reading this book, you might recall the quarrelsome couple nearby, the insincere relationships of people you know, and the unpleasant emotions.

This is the reason I don't recommend reading it, from a aesthetic perspective, the writing style and plot of the book are dull and uninteresting, unless you have a dramatic change in life circumstances or a sweet tooth, otherwise, your reading experience will be one of confusion and boredom.

From a deeper perspective, daily situations do not illuminate or expand one's thoughts and vision (this differs from Marx's "The Failure of Love During the Period of Decline"), and brief segments do not explore any problems, such as what errors led to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I don't recommend reading this book, it doesn't matter whether you read it or not.
The author's thoughts are more expressed through techniques and styles rather than the story plot, which is also a reason why the reading experience of this book is not as good.
Suitable for coarse reading, cannot be fine-tuned.
The logic of this book is very good, but the content is not rich enough.

Both domestic and foreign examples exist, including well-known entrepreneurs and salespeople as well as unknown individuals.
I'm not sure if it's a made-up story or not, but if you provide some real-life examples from personal experiences, it will be more convincing.
On the term "customer" or "client" there is a shift coming and going.
Title: Customer, content: Client.
The electronic book also has problems with misspelled words, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering.

In summary, this book makes a good choice as an entry-level theory for those who want to get into sales, but for those who are already involved in sales and want to improve their sales skills, it may not be suitable.

And as for the time when the book was written, the later development of WeChat and Alipay has not been mentioned, and the current third-party payment proportion is not even close to what was predicted in the book, it's much higher.

However, I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book, as it is evident that the author has at least a decade of financial observation experience, is familiar with the financial development history of both China and abroad, and can therefore write such easily understandable content.

The first element that determines a person's job satisfaction is not the level of pay, but whether they receive sufficient recognition and appreciation in their work.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after basic physiological needs are met, the most pressing psychological needs are to be understood, recognized, and appreciated.
Yes, for most Chinese people, it's like "love is in the heart that can't be expressed", even if they have love, gratitude, and praise, they won't openly say it.
The author described five types of praise in this book: flattering language, polite timing, courteous behavior, sincere gifts, and physical touch.

I think what's important is not what five languages you know and can use to praise others, but being able to express your gratitude and appreciation towards the people around you, regardless of whether they are family members, friends, or colleagues, with a sincere and genuine heart.
The more close relationships one has, the more they need to be appreciated and grateful, and this is how our lives can become more beautiful.
Learning to appreciate, the company can also retain talent to some extent, reduce turnover rate.
